New Records: Jack Leiter's 12 whiffs on his fastball alone was the fourth-most by any Texas starter this season
Key Match Events: Los Angeles leadoff hitter Taylor Ward drilled a middle-middle slider into left field for a solo home run to begin the game
Jack Leiter hit Los Angeles shortstop Zach Neto in the next at-bat
Leiter then retired 15 of the next 17 batters he faced before Neto worked that leadoff walk in the sixth inning
Anthony Rendon flyout in the first inning
Pre-Game Insights: Jack Leiter discussed his mental and physical strides taken for Texas Rangers
Post-Match Reflections: Rangers manager Bruce Bochy said, 'He made pitches when he had to. He was a little bit erratic at times, but he regrouped and that's what's important. He didn't let it get away from him.'

Shortstop Josh Smith said, 'Honestly, this win is kind of on him. Keeping us in the game, giving us a chance. I thought Jack was really good tonight. I thought he was good in his last start too. He's progressing pretty well.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas
Others: The article mentions that Jack Leiter has made three consecutive starts in Texas' rotation after his first three in the season's first half came on a spot basis
